alert.note: Alert for Allen; De Kalb; Kosciusko; Lagrange; Noble; Steuben; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 3:49PM EDT until June 25 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Steuben County in northeastern Indiana... Northern Allen County in northeastern Indiana... Noble County in northeastern Indiana... Northern Whitley County in northeastern Indiana... De Kalb County in northeastern Indiana... East central Kosciusko County in north central Indiana... Southern Lagrange County in northeastern Indiana... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 349 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Topeka to near Albion to 6 miles southeast of North Webster, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Albion and Rome City around 355 PM EDT. Kendallville and Lagrange around 400 PM EDT. Avilla and Churubusco around 405 PM EDT. Auburn around 415 PM EDT. Huntertown and Waterloo around 420 PM EDT. Angola and Garrett around 425 PM EDT. Butler, Hamilton and Grabill around 430 PM EDT. St. Joe around 435 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Honeyville, Alvarado, Fairfield Center, Saint Johns, Blue Lake, Hamilton Lake, Laotto, Moore, Big Long Lake and Salem Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 318 and 352. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 150 and 156. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for north central and northeastern Indiana...and northwestern Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Allen; De Kalb; Kosciusko; Lagrange; Noble; Steuben; Whitley
